Estimate Pearson's partial correlation coefficients.

Source: R/create-network.R
nc_partial_corr_matrix.Rd

This function is a wrapper around ppcor::pcor() that extracts correlation coefficient estimates, then adds the variable names to the column and row names.

nc_partial_corr_matrix(.data)

Arguments

.data

Input data of metabolic variables as matrix or data.frame.

Value

Outputs a matrix of partial correlation coefficients.

Examples


library(dplyr)
simulated_data %>%
  select(contains("metabolite")) %>%
  nc_partial_corr_matrix()
#>               metabolite_1 metabolite_10 metabolite_11 metabolite_12
#> metabolite_1   1.000000000   0.055485627  -0.012440234   0.256753103
